duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform preventative maintenance, installations, and troubleshooting on medical equipment within a hospital or healthcare system.
Maintain customer relationships and ensure timely communication and resolution to drive customer satisfaction.
Adhere to company policies, procedures, and hospital protocols to ensure regulatory and compliance requirements are met, including documentation of all work performed.
Be available after-hours and/or work a rotating on-call schedule, including weekends.
Act with humility, build trust, lead with transparency, deliver with focus, and drive ownership with unyielding integrity.

education_certification.credential: Associate's degree, Bachelor's degree, military education, or High School Diploma / GED with 4+ years’ experience servicing electronic equipment.
Legal authorization to work in the U.S.
